Oral appliances are an alternative to CPAP therapy for mild to moderate OSA. Oral appliances are not as effective as CPAP in reducing AHI.
Maxillomandibular advancement surgery improves the AHI and can be considered for patients who do not benefit from or tolerate positive airway pressure therapy.
